channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2015 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Investigators: Plane's engines had problems
item.description: The pilots of TransAsia Airways Flight GE235 grappled with problems with both the plane's engines before issuing a mayday alert to air traffic control, Taiwan's Aviation Safety Council said Friday.

item.title: Dramatic images of plane crash
item.description: A TransAsia plane carrying 58 people hits a bridge in Taiwan's capital, Taipei, before crashing into a river.

item.title: U.N.: ISIS sells kids as slaves
item.description: ISIS is subjecting Iraqi children to a series of horrors, including torture, abduction and putting price tags on them for sale as slaves, the United Nations said.

item.title: Jordan going after ISIS
item.description: Jordanian Foreign Minister Nasser Judeh vowed Thursday to destroy ISIS. "We're going after them ... with everything that we have." FULL STORY | PHOTOS: THE ISIS TERROR THREAT | JORDAN REACTS

item.title: 2 dead on S. Carolina campus
item.description: A fatal shooting at the University of South Carolina appears to be a murder-suicide, a police spokesman said Thursday.

item.title: Katy Perry's lawyers go after Left Shark vendor
item.description: The "Left Shark," as seen dancing awkwardly behind Katy Perry during Sunday night's Super Bowl, became nothing short of an overnight phenomenon, spinning off memes for days afterward on social media.

item.title: Hubble catches triple eclipse
item.description: The Hubble space telescope peers hundreds, thousands, millions of light years into the universe to study novas, quasars and nebulas.

item.title: Hambycast: New Hampshire state of mind
item.description: There's cold, and then there's New-Hampshire-in-winter cold.

item.title: Texans demand an apology, sir
item.description: Rep. Alcee Hastings wants his colleagues from Texas to make like Elsa, the protagonist in the hit kids' movie "Frozen" and, "Let it go."

item.title: Rep.: Texas is 'crazy state'
item.description: During a House hearing, things got heated up after Florida Rep. Alcee Hastings referred to Texas as a 'crazy state.' CNN's Dana Bash reports.

item.title: Witness: She stopped, then drove into train's path
item.description: Friends remember Ellen Brody, a mother of three, as someone who wasn't careless or put others at risk.

item.title: Cops: Boy 'kidnapped' as lesson
item.description: A 6-year-old boy in Missouri endured an emotional four-hour staged kidnapping because his family thought he was being too nice to people he didn't know, police said Thursday.

item.title: Teen goes to Target for a tie, walks out a star
item.description: Turns out, talking to strangers is not so bad after all.

item.title: Who's who in the Bobbi Kristina Brown case?
item.description: As Bobbi Kristina Brown remains in a medically induced coma fighting for her life, little information about the incident at her Atlanta-area home or her condition has slipped from police or family.

item.title: Where a box of condoms costs $755
item.description: Shortages of basic products such as corn, milk and chicken have plagued Venezuela for years, creating long lines at supermarkets and pushing inflation well past the 60% mark just in the last year alone.

item.title: Paris Hilton's brother: Passengers are 'peasants'
item.description: Conrad Hilton, the younger brother of celebrity heiress Paris Hilton, allegedly threatened and intimidated flight attendants on a British Airways flight from London to Los Angeles last summer, using profanity, smoking in the bathroom and calling passengers "peasants," federal authorities charged this week.

item.title: Traumatized teen told by 911 to 'stop whining'
item.description: A Maryland 911 operator has been disciplined after telling a traumatized teen to "stop whining." CNN affiliate WBAL has more.

item.title: Scruffy man donates millions
item.description: Before Ronald Read died last summer, he was, on several occasions, the benefactor of another person's generosity.

item.title: Cops: Man raped women in fake sleep study
item.description: Police say around 100 women in Japan who thought they were participating in a sleep study were actually drugged and raped, their attacks recorded and sold to porn sites.

item.title: SI's swimsuit edition gets more curves
item.description: Ever wanted a Sports Illustrated swimsuit edition with even more curves?

item.title: John Legend boycotts Beverly Hills Hotel
item.description: Up for two Grammys and his first Oscar, John Legend is the dapper cover star of Los Angeles Confidential's latest issue and an honoree at the magazine's big entertainment bash Thursday at the Beverly Hills Hotel. Yet the R&B star is declining the invitation.

item.title: 'Tonight' hosts 'Saved by the Bell,' '227' reunions
item.description: Who knew Jimmy Fallon went to Bayside High?

item.title: All not impressed by 'Saved by the Bell' skit
item.description: "Saved by the Bell" reunion called "greatest '90s nostalgia porn." CNN's Jeanne Moos has "Saved by the Bell" for dummies.

item.title: 911 dispatcher breaks rules for dying toddler
item.description: During a call about a toddler who wasn't breathing, a 911 dispatcher guided the family through CPR, despite his police department's lack of certification.

item.title: Ex-spy chief disappears in scandal's latest twist
Opinion: Brian Williams broke public trust
Other famous people who misremembered
item.description: Television anchor Bryan Williams isn't the first person to be embarrassed by claiming a remembrance that, well, never really happened. Recent history shows how several famous figures suffered what one expert labels a false "flashbulb" memory.

item.title: Pilot: Brian Williams' chopper took fire
item.description: Pilot who flew the helicopter NBC's Brian Williams' and his crew were on says Williams "was there at time of attack," noting "we were all scared."

item.title: He turns 50 this week; who's about to join him?
Punish misbehaving kids with 'old man' haircut
item.description: Never has a single haircut caused such a fuss.

item.title: Skier Bode Miller has surgery after crash
item.description: Could Bode Miller's career be over? The US skier severed a hamstring tendon in a high-speed crash at the World Championships in Beaver Creek, Colorado.

item.title: Horses' fate: Racing or death
item.description: On the northern Japanese island of Hokkaido, the life of a horse may be tracked down two distinct paths.

item.title: Young Native Americans celebrating their culture
This is what a pit bull-dachshund mix looks like
item.description: An unusual dog that is part pit bull and part dachshund is waiting to be adopted in Georgia.

item.title: Monopoly set to come with $23K in REAL money
item.description: Don't call it "Monopoly money."

item.title: Officer busts a move for dashcam test
item.description: An officer with Missouri's Smithville Police Department decided to have some fun while testing out his squad car's dashcam recorder.

item.title: 'I married an ISIS fighter to save my dad's life'
New hotel to be staffed by robots
item.description: The robot revolution may be gentler than we thought.

item.title: Cops: Armstrong let girlfriend take crash blame
item.description: Former cycling champ Lance Armstrong struck two parked vehicles as he drove home from a night of partying but wasn't charged until his longtime girlfriend admitted she wasn't behind the wheel, according to police in Aspen, Colorado.

item.title: Oscar-nominated actress lands 'Star Wars' lead
item.description: After a series of hush-hush readings and tests, Lucasfilm and Disney have zeroed in on Oscar-nominated actress Felicity Jones for the female lead in the Star Wars stand-alone film.

item.title: World Hijab Day encourages women to try covering up
Giant security gap at U.S. airports?
item.description: The vast majority of airport employees with direct access to the tarmac and airplanes do not go through any daily security screening, and only two of the country's major airports have systems in place that require all employees with secure access to pass through metal detectors, a CNN investigation has found.

item.title: Royal Caribbean cruise cut short by illness
item.description: The trip wasn't so grand for many guests on board Royal Caribbean's Grandeur of the Seas.

item.title: After massacre, teachers pack guns
50-foot 'dragon' dinosaur unearthed by farmers
item.description: Paleontologists have discovered a 50-foot "dragon" dinosaur species in China that may have roamed the earth 160 million years ago during the Late Jurassic period.

item.title: Hart, Ferrell, Fallon face off in epic lip sync battle
item.description: Comedians Kevin Hart, Will Ferrell and Jimmy Fallon have the most epic lip sync battle in history.

item.title: Oscar winner comes out
Miss Universe loss overshadows winner
